AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: R.J. Redmon, Data Access provided by NGDC in Coordination with AFRL and the University of Colorado, Boulder. Please acknowledge the Data Providers. If you find Problems, please report them. Please acknowledge the data providers and CDAWeb when using these data.

Parameter.Name: Epoch Time
Parameter.Description: Epoch Time, Default
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter exhibits an increasing monotonic progression.

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Position, ECI
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Position, Earth Centered Inertial, ECI, Cartesian Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: Epoch is True of Date, TOD. These ECI Coordinates are calculated from an SPDF SSC Locator 1 min Ephemeris using an Eight Order Interpolation, Burden, R.L., and Faires, J.D., Numerical Analysis, 5th Ed., PWS Publishing Company, Boston, 1993. Using SPDF Methods, the expected Accuracy is on the Order of a few km.

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Latitude, GEO
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Latitude, Geographic Inertial, GEO, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated by using IDL Astro Library Function ECI2GEO

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Longitude, GEO
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Longitude, Geographic Inertial, GEO, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated by using IDL Astro Library Function ECI2GEO

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Geocentric Distance
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Geocentric Distance

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Latitude, AACGM
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Latitude, Altitude Adjusted Corrected Geomagnetic, AACGM, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated by using the SuperDARN AACGM IDL Library. Values are the Result of linearly interpolating between two nearest AACGM 5 Year Epochs.

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Longitude, AACGM
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Longitude, Altitude Adjusted Corrected Geomagnetic, AACGM, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated by using the SuperDARN AACGM IDL Library. Values are the Result of linearly interpolating between two nearest AACGM 5 Year Epochs.

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Local Time, AACGM
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Local Time, Altitude Adjusted Corrected Geomagnetic, AACGM, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated by using the SuperDARN AACGM IDL Library. Values are the Result of linearly interpolating between two nearest AACGM 5 Year Epochs.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field, Spacecraft Frame
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Field as originally measured in Spacecraft Frame
Parameter.Caveats: X is Geodedic Nadir, Down, Y is along Spacecraft Track, the Ram Direction, Z is Across-Track to the Right. Note, the Pertrubations in this Variable have been recomputed from the Observed B-Field. IGRF11 was run using this Day as Epoch to compute a new, more accurate Geocentric Location that was rotated into Spacecraft Coordinates and then removed.

Parameter.Name: Delta-B, measured minus IGRF, Spacecraft Frame
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Delta Magnetic Field, Delta-B, which is equal to the originally measured Magnetic Field minus the International Geomagnetic Reference Field, IGRF, Model Magnetic Field, Spacecraft Frame
Parameter.Caveats: X is Geodedic Nadir, Down, Y is along Spacecraft Track, the Ram Direction, Z is Across-Track to the Right

Parameter.Name: Baseline corrected Delta-B, GEO
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Baseline corrected Delta-B, Geographic, GEO, Spherical, East, North, Up, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: Finite Differences between adjacent Points on Spacecraft Track were used to determine along Track and across Track Unit Vectors in GEO. No Altitude Change between adjacent Points was assumed. Baseline Correction, F. Rich's MFIT Procedure, is Polynomial Fit every Half-Pass to each Component of Delta-B in Spacecraft Coordinates by using only Data from Regions equatorward of the DMSP Auroral Boundary from the CEDAR Database.

Parameter.Name: Baseline corrected Delta-B, APX
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Baseline corrected Delta-B, Modified Apex, APX, Coordinates, Reference Height 110 km
Parameter.Caveats: Coordinates transformed with APEX-PYTHON, NCAR HAO, with Reference Altitude equal to 110 km, See Richmond, J. Geomag. Geoelec., 1995. Baseline Correction, F. Rich's MFIT Procedure, is Polynomial Fit every Half-Pass to each Component of Delta-B in Spacecraft Coordinates by using only Data from Regions equatorward of the DMSP Auroral Boundary from the CEDAR Database.

Parameter.Name: Baseline corrected Delta-B, Spacecraft Frame
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Baseline corrected Delta-B, Spacecraft Frame
Parameter.Caveats: X is Geodedic Nadir, Down, Y is along Spacecraft Track, the Ram Direction, Z is Across-Track to the Right. Baseline Correction, F. Rich's MFIT Procedure, is Polynomial Fit every Half-Pass to each Component of Delta-B in Spacecraft Coordinates by using only Data from Regions equatorward of the DMSP Auroral Boundary from the CEDAR Database.

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Latitude, APX
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Latitude, Modified Apex Geomagnetic, APXGM, Coordinates, Reference Height 110 km
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated by using Apex-Python, which is based on Apex Fortran Code available from CEDAR Database with the nearest Year Epoch

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Longitude, APX
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Longitude, Modified Apex Geomagnetic, APXGM, Coordinates, Reference Height 110 km
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated by using Apex-Python, which is based on Apex Fortran Code available from CEDAR Database with the nearest Year Epoch

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Local Time, APX
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Local Time, Modified Apex Geomagnetic, APXGM, Coordinates, Reference Height 110 km
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated by using Apex-Python, which is based on Apex Fortran Code available from CEDAR Database with the nearest Year Epoch

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Region Code
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Region Code: 1=Equatorial, 2=Auroral, 3=Polar
Parameter.Caveats: 0-No Boundary Identified, 1-Equatorward of the Auroral Zone, 2-Auroral Zone, 3-Polar Cap

Parameter.Name: Auroral Boundary Determination, FOM
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Auroral Boundary Determination Figure of Merit, FOM: OK if Equal to 2 or Greater
Parameter.Caveats: Typical Range 0-4. Less than 2 is Suspect. See the DMSP CDF User Manual for full Specification of FOM Computation.

Parameter.Name: Orbit Index by Day
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Integer representing the Orbit of the Day, signed by Hemisphere: >0=Northern, <0=Southern
Parameter.Caveats: Orbit Start and End are determined by Crossings of the Apex Magnetic Equator. A value of 0 denotes the first Equator Crossing of the Day.

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Ram Velocity Direction, Unit Vector, GEO
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Ram Velocity Direction, Unit Vector, Geographic, GEO, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: This is an Estimate, based on a Spherical Trigonometry Approach by using a Great-Circle Arc between adjacent Points, See the User Manual.

Parameter.Name: Unit Vector across the Spacecraft Track, GEO
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Unit Vector across the Spacecraft Track to the Left and Orthogonal to the Spacecraft Ram Velocity Direction, Geographic, GEO, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: This is an Estimate, based on a Spherical Trigonometry Approach by using a Great-Circle Arc between adjacent Points, See the User Manual.
